title: Various Techniques and Practices of Hypnosis and Fascination
first_phrase: This text explores the techniques of crisis and Ericksonian hypnosis, with a focus on the fascinating and ecstatic aspects of therapy. It starts with the history of ecstatic experiences, including those associated with the Kundalini energy, and goes into the physiological effects and personal experiences associated with fascination. The latter half of the text delves into different techniques of fascination, including the Pisa Method, the use of reflected light, and the auto-fascination of the mirror. It concludes with discussions on various types of hypnosis, such as clairvoyance and quantum hypnosis, and topics like the use of sensory systems in trance and the connection between PNL and hypnosis.
